page.title: 09Riviere Farm
page.content: The owners had a lot of potato fields. Some fields had already been harvested for their new potatoes.The earlier they are drawn the higher price they get.In four & a half acres they normaly got 50 tons of potatoes.To do a field by hand would take from Tuesday to Friday.The machine would be a lot cheaper,because of the less men, but it takes longer.One field of potatoes was for Smiths Crisps.A pipe ran through the fields for irrigating the crops.The water costs Â£1.17 per 1000 gallons.They use 80000 gallons a day.They have a lot of beef cattle on their farm in Connor Downs but not so many at the farm we went to.The cattle get slaughtered at 10 months old.The bulls that we saw were 7 months old. They were dehorned at 3 weeks.Their farm has 200 acres,60 of which is rented.
